thread.title: Boy, 17, and girl, 16, die after car they were travelling in smashed into a tree
thread.title_full: Boy, 17, and girl, 16, die after car they were travelling in smashed into a tree

author: Scarlet Howes
title: Boy, 17, and girl, 16, die after car they were travelling in smashed into a tree
text:
Boy, 17, and girl, 16, die after car they were travelling in smashed into a tree A 19-year-old driver of the car has been arrested and remains in police custody Share Friends have named the passengers as Levi Dickinson and Rhogan Jones online as they pay tribute to them (Photo: Facebook/Guzelian) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Two teenagers were killed when their car smashed into a tree last night in East Yorkshire. 
The 16-year-old, locally named as Levi Dickinson, and 17-year-old Rhogan Jones, died at the scene. 
Devastated friends and family took to social media to pay tribute to the pair, who have been described as "beautiful souls". 
Levi's sister Vicki Horner wrote a heartbreaking message to her 'little princess': "Rip my beautiful princess u was the most loving caring person our lives will never be the same again u was my whole world u didn't deserve this ur little sis is devastated fly high my beautiful angel." 
In a touching tribute to Rhogan, one friend Shannon Jade wrote: “You’ll forever be missed!! Shine bright up there lad, RIP”. 
Another said: “R.I.P Rhogan & Levi, thoughts are with all friends and family. Life can be so cruel”. Levi died after a car collided with a tree yesterday evening in East Yorkshire. (Photo: Facebook/Guzelian) 
A Selby College spokesperson paid tribute to the student, saying: “Rogan was a popular student who studied Engineering at college but left in 2016. 
“Our thoughts go out to his family and friends at this sad time.” 
Police have since arrested the driver of the car, a 19-year-old, who suffered minor injuries after the crash. 
He remains in police custody. 
A witness at the scene at 7am this morning said there was car debris along the road and evidence of the trees being "crushed". Heartbroken friends and family of Levi have expressed their condolences on Facebook (Photo: Facebook/Guzelian) 
"The trees are bashed down and there are orange markers from where the police have been," he said. "There is a bumper in the hedgerow and other bits of plastic and car debris at the side of the road." 
A Humberside Police spokesman said: "We are appealing for witnesses after two teenagers died in a road traffic collision on the old A63 towards Howden close to the junction with Knedlington Road, Howden at 8.15pm last night. 
"A green Volkswagen Polo left the road and collided with a tree. 
"The two passengers - a 16-year-old girl and 17-year-old boy sadly both died at the scene. Specially trained traffic officers have been deployed to support the families of the teenagers who died. 
"The driver of the car - a 19-year-old man - sustained minor injuries. He has been arrested and is currently in police custody assisting us with our enquiries." In a touching tribute to Rhogan, one friend Shannon Jade wrote: “You’ll forever be missed" (Photo: Facebook/Guzelian) 
A fundraising page has been set up in memory of Levi by best friend Chantelle Taylor to help pay for her funeral costs. 
She said: "My gorgeous best friend sadly lost her life in a car accident last night. 
"Levi was loved by so many and had her whole life ahead of her, any thing will do just to give this beautiful girl the best send off she would of wanted!! Help her family out." 
To donate, go here .
